findings.lower_chest: Bibasilar atelectasis. No large pleural effusion or pericardial effusion. Coronary artery calcifications are moderate.

abdominal.hepatobiliary: The liver demonstrates homogenous attenuation throughout. There is no evidence of focal lesions. There is no evidence of intrahepatic or extrahepatic biliary dilatation. The gallbladder is surgically absent.
abdominal.pancreas: 1.1 x 1.5 cm hypodense cystic lesion in the proximal pancreatic body appears increased in size compared to 0.6 x 0.7 cm previously. This is associated with soft tissue stranding about the pancreatic head and body. No pancreatic ductal dilation is identified.
abdominal.spleen: Normal size with subtle peripheral hypodensity likely reflecting prior infarct, new from prior exam.
abdominal.adrenals: Right adrenal gland is normal. 1.3 x 1.3 cm left adrenal nodule is unchanged compared to previous and characterized as an adrenal adenoma.
abdominal.urinary_system: Mild right renal cortical scarring. Multiple bilateral renal cystic structures up to 2.6 x 2.4 cm in the right upper pole kidney. No focal renal lesions or hydronephrosis.
abdominal.gastrointestinal: Stomach unremarkable. Small bowel loops normal. Colon and rectum within normal limits. Appendix not visualized, no signs of appendicitis.
abdominal.pelvis: Urinary bladder and distal ureters unremarkable. No free fluid.
abdominal.vascular: No abdominal aortic aneurysm. Extensive atherosclerotic disease noted.
abdominal.bones: No evidence of worrisome osseous lesions or acute fracture.
abdominal.soft_tissues: Abdominal and pelvic wall within normal limits.

pancreas.change: Increased in size compared to previous examination.

spleen.change: Subtle peripheral hypodensity likely reflects prior infarct, new from prior exam.
